intro: Oenothera apicaborta, commonly known as the desert evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has hairy, branching stems and narrow, linear leaves that help it conserve water in arid environments. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by moths and other nocturnal insects. Oenothera apicaborta is adapted to sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun.
